reviewText: I have long wanted a DVD on Linda Ronstadt singing her greatest hits but one has not been available.  This DVD states that it contains all of her hit songs.  It doesn't.  It does contain "You're No Good" and "When Will I Be Loved", both of which I did want on the DVD.  The DVD does NOT contain "Heat Wave", "It's So Easy", "Blue Bayou",  or "Different Drum".  These are all hits I wanted to see her sing on the DVD in addition to those I mentioned that are on the DVD.  I was very disappointed.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Well, here we have another Ronstadt bootleg DVD. This bootleg isn't as good as the early 80's Ronstadt concert titled Faithless Love. I'm giving "Pride" 3 stars solely on the sound quality and she performs 2 of my all time favorite songs of hers Tracks of my Tears and Hasten Down the Wind. The picture quality is fair. One song has an black bar going across it. Not sure what that's all about. Also it looks like the camera man turned the camera on and off between songs.So if your an fan of Linda Ronstadt and you solely want an concert of hers to listen to and not take to seriously then pick this one up. These bootleg Ronstadt concerts will sadly have to do until an studio releases something official. On a side note I'm also an fan of Barbra Streisand, Celine Dion, and Sarah McLachlan and every concert DVD I have of theirs is official and in high quality. I honestly don't know why Amazon even is selling these bootleg Ronstadt concert DVD's.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Laser Media, the company that released this DVD should be ashamed to be within a mile of the word "laser."  Normally when I see that word I expect a product with sharpness, both visually and aurally.  This poor excuse of a DVD is neiither.  Remember back in the Eighties when you recorded something off cable onto a VHS tape, played it multiple times then put it away and then pulled to out a few years later, only to be surprised to see how badly the picture had deteriorated?  That will give you a rough idea of the quality of this offering from Laser Media.Sure, there's plenty of great Ronstadt tunes from one of my favorite vocalists.  There's very little between-song patter, just abrupt jumps from one song to the next.  As for the sound quality, I've heard much better amateur recordings of modern-day concert recordings from smartphones on YouTube.  At least you don't have to listen to the conversations of other concert goers during the songs on this DVD as you would on a YouTube recording but that's the only advantage that comes to mind.My advice, should you still decide to purchase this DVD, is to just use it for background listening.  Actually sitting down to watch it will only infuriate you.  I'm giving it three stars solely due to the quality of the songs, the musicianship of  band members Kenny, Waddy and Andrew and others and the fact that Linda's voice still shines through this travesty of a recording of what was otherwise a great concert.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is clearly a rip-off. I'm sure it's a bootlegged, illegal recording of a Linda Ronstadt concert. While Ms. Ronstadt sings beautifully and the all-star band (Andrew Gold, Waddy Wachtel, etc.) rocks out, the video is strictly amateur and the sound quality is lamentable. I very much doubt if this travesty was approved by the artist. She should sue the video company.
summary: Dreadful Quality Video of Great Singer Who Deserves Better

reviewText: LOVE HAS NO PRIDE (DVD): Vocally, Linda Ronstadt is incomparable. In these sixteen songs, filmed at a live concert in 1976 (she was a mere thirty years old), her voice is powerful and well controlled, her dynamics and enunciation are flawless, and her range and timbre are exceptional. Selections include (among others): You Are No Good; That Will Be The Day; When Will I Be Loved; Silver Threads And Golden Needles; and twelve other hits. The filming is simplistic and at times is almost amateurish, but her charisma and musicality are captured adequately. No mention is made of the location of the concert or the sidemen (two guitars, electric bass, keyboards, and drums—and Ms. Ronstadt on her iconic tambourine). The word “adornment” cannot be associated with Ms. Ronstadt: the melody and lyrics are never lost, and throughout the performance, she wears jeans and an off-the-shoulder white top (with a flower in her hair). Suffice it to say, every song can evoke emotion in the viewer. For those who enjoy popular-country-rock, this DVD will provide an abundance of listening enjoyment.As an addendum to the Love Has No Pride DVD review, psychologically there is considerable depth to the title. In teaching attraction theory in social psychology, defining the term “love” to undergraduate students is always a challenge. Exploring the term “Love Has No Pride” can produce psychological insights.
Title: N/A
